Students: Adam Collins, William Kopellas, David Simpson
Title: Analyzing the Built Environment and Human Behavior through the Creation of an Immersive Space
Abstract: Components of the interior environment like light, color, sound, and spatial shape have been studied but still, a comprehensive, multivariable understanding is not clear. Current studies focused on self-reports and questionnaires do not adequately control and study all factors; this emphasizes the need to identify the impacts of architectural elements instead, on the axes of the cognitive domain. To address these challenges, we designed and constructed an immersive space: a kinetic architecture installation equipped to change light, color, sound, and spatial shape. For this MQP, we utilized the space to explore the effect of light intensity on a subject while completing a puzzle by measuring physiological and neural activity.
